data.question: What is the chemical formula for the compound with chiral triple-helical strands mentioned?
At what temperature do the spins on the manganese ions within the compound display ferrimagnetic order?
What phenomenon involves alteration of the absorbance of a substance with ordinary light according to the directions of the magnetic field and incident radiation?
What is the coordination geometry of the heptanuclear unit of [{CrIII(CN)6}(MnII l-NH2ala)3]·3 H2O?
data.answer: The coordination geometry involves two types of functional groups to bridge between two adjacent MnII ions.

data.question: What is the Weiss temperature of the compounds as per the Curie–Weiss law?
What is the saturation magnetization value for the compounds at 2 K?
What is the main factor governing the formation of the triple-helical-strand structure in the compounds?
data.answer: The rigid frame of the helical chain and not hydrogen bonding between helical chains.

data.question: Why is the magnetic transition temperature of the compounds relatively low?
data.answer: Due to the comparatively long cyanide-bridged distance and possibly spin frustration between manganese ions.

data.question: What leads to the construction of two differing chelating rings around the MnII ion?
data.answer: The unique coordination of two amino moieties and one carboxyl group within the aminoalanine ion.

data.question: What is the expected outcome of the initial construction of an infinite helical chain of ligated MII?
data.answer: Formation of a multiple helical structure of MII.

data.question: What is the role of the hexacyanometalate [MIII(CN)6]3(cid:1) ion in the compounds?
data.answer: It connects between adjacent helical structures containing MII through cyanide bridges.

data.question: What does the abrupt increase of the cmolT value around 30 K suggest?
data.answer: The onset of three-dimensional magnetic ordering.

data.question: True or False: The compounds exhibit antiferromagnetic behavior below 35 K.
True or False: Hydrogen bonds are the main factor governing the formation of the triple-helical-strand structure.
True or False: The magnetic transition temperature is high due to the formation of a three-dimensional cyanide network.
True or False: The compounds were synthesized from the reaction of manganese(ii) complex with an alanine derivative and hexacyanochromate(iii) ion.
True or False: The compounds have a triple-helical structure with counterclockwise and clockwise turns around the manganese ion obtained from d and l isomers, respectively.
True or False: The shortest and longest Cr···Mn distances through cyanide bridges are significantly shorter than those in previous crystals.
True or False: The compounds exhibit ferrimagnetic behavior below 25 K.
True or False: The main factor governing the formation of the triple-helical-strand structure is the positive charge of the manganese ions.
